page.title: 16SHILLINGSTONE BUILDINGS
page.content: There are several 16c cottages in Shillingstone,and a number of 17c and 18c buildings.There is a 15c cross now much restored,and there was a Tudor manor house ,burnt down in 1923.Many of the old cottages have thatched roofs. The cider orchards have given way to new buildings and the original allotments to a council estate,now mostly owner occupied. At the hamlet of Fiddleford the DOE are restoring the 12c manor house.The Fiddleford Inn is a 13c building. Child Okeford has a large number of newly built bungalows,mainly occupied by retired people.
